result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C. Kasch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: ***No restitution hearing requested by the defendant. Restitution be entered in the amount of $7555.42 joint/several with the co-defendant.  In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.***

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain gainful employment.  Defendant to obtain a HSED during the pendency of probation term.

No contact with C. O'Keefe and or J. Borchardt directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Good Time Credit granted.  Sentence to be served without Work Release.   Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.

Costs reimposed in the amount of $1283.54.  Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Unpaid Restitution balance in the amount of $2924.64 will be collected as a condition of probation as to companion Waushara Co Case No. 2017CM000442.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned)-tpg
RN/SDCL returned
Letter to Clerk, Dated 3/7/2018 Re: Conclusion of Representation

14CF-92, 17CM-442 and 17CM-575 - All Cases Called @ 11:05 AM:  Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Global resolution expected today and recited by DA.  Time Served Credit calculated as 217 days.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  Atty Seifert intends to argue solely as to SEHR recommendation and she agrees with TS calculation.    17CM-442 and 17CM-575:    Defendant advised of potential punishment with increased penalty as to Repeater Enhancer.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  17CM-442 Pleas Ct 2 CDTP w/Repeater Enh: NC  Plea Ct 4 Theft w/Rep - NC   Plea Ct 5 Resist w/Repeater Enh: NC  17CM-575 Plea Ct 1 Resisting w/Repeater Enh:  NC    Plea Ct 4 BJump w/Repeater Enh:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC to each charge.  17CM-442 Cts 1 and 3 DRI.  17CM-575 Cts 2 and 3 DRI. Uncharged Referral received for potential BJump, Violation Date 12/9/2017 - DA Case No 17WS08785 - is also DRI.  Defendant's mother makes statement to the Court prior to SEH.  Defendant's father makes statement to the Court prior to SEH. Argument by DA as to SEH recommendation.  Argument by Atty Seifert as to SEH recommendation.  Statement by Def prior to SEH: None offered.  The Court:  14CF-92 - 1 yr direct SEH with GT and 217 TS credit.  Approx 53 days left to serve to complete that SEH.  SEH w/o Work Release privileges.   17CM-442 and 17CM-575:  S/W - 3 yrs probation as to each count - permissible due to 5 charges, consecutive to 14CF-92.  Ct 2 of 17CM-442:  5 mos WCJ, consecutive to 14CF-92 - degree of accountability reflected - not being sent to prison.  No Work Release and No GT.  Conditions of Probation:  Rest that is carried over from 14CF-92 of $2924.64, payments to commence of no less than $200 per mo commencing 10/1/2018; Rest of $310.74 Joint and Several as to 17CM-442 - same repayment schedule; Psych Eval and any follow up treatment as required by that eval; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; AODA and any follow thru as deemed appropriate; Obtain HSED or GED; No contact with Derrick Girmscheid, Rebecca Clark and/or victim; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.   DNA Sample (on file) and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 27, 2018 at 11:00 am.

17CF-92, 17CM-442 and 17CM-575 - All Cases Called @ 11:07 AM: Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Defendant Michael C. Kasch in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Seifert:  Defense is prepared to move forward with the SEHR only today with a bifurcated P/S on the CM matters.  P/S scheduled for 2/27/2018 @ 11:00 AM.  14CF-92 SEHR proceeds:  Counsel admit receipt of Rev Ord and Warrant.  No factual corrections offered.  Chapter 950 in compliance.  Argument by ADA as to sentencing recommendation - argues for 3 yr bifurcated SEH - 1 yr IC/2 yrs ES.  Argument by Atty Seifert as to sentencing recommendation - argues for County Jail sentence with civil judgment on unpaid Restitution.   The Court:  SEHR deferred to and until 2/27/2018.  Add'l time required to craft a fair response to all these cases.  Issues regarding Restitution need to be explored.  Court is concerned over the unaddressed Restitution - Balance remains of $3024.64.  Options also being considered as to Prison vs. Co Jail being imposed.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for February 27, 2018 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: 14CF92 & 14CM244 Cases called @ 11:47 a.m. Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 14CM244 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Carver. No statement by defendant. Court orders: S/W 30 months probation - Conditions: Restitution in the amount of $7555.42, defendant may request a restitution hearing within 30 days-hearing to be held within 60 days, if no hearing is requested restitution to be entered J/S with the co-defendant, N/C w/ C. O'Keefe and/or J. Borchardt, Maintain gainful employment, Obtain an HSED, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, DNA sample and surcharge, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2014 at 11:30 am.
